item.title: Black future for coal miners
item.author: Kathryn Hazlehurst,
item.description: Decades after pit closures that claimed 170,000 jobs across England, coalfield communities continue to suffer from chronic arthritis, asthma and long-term back problems. Researchers at Durham University found that people living in coalfield areas were 27 per cent more likely to suffer from a …

item.title: Government calls for better circus animal welfare
item.author: Kathryn Hazlehurst,
item.description: Martin Lacey stands proudly in the centre of the big top, arms splayed, red suit barely stretching over his ample belly. His ungainly appearance is deceptive. To a roar from the crowd, he drops to his knees as a flash of white and black passes above his bald head. The lion lands with a snarl, and …
